content.raw: Note there are use cases where the old behavior is actually beneficial. Say you have a spinning LIDAR that is mounted on a robot that uses simplified boxy collision geometry and the LIDAR partly or completely spins inside this geometry. When this bug is fixed, it gets very hard to keep simplified geometry and simultaneously let the sensor ignore it.
